values:
I have been living on the edge of sanity-insanity. Either I will kill someone or break everything on my way. I haven't been well for so long a time that I think I am getting depressed. People I thought they were close friends have been strange to me.I know I have been quite grouchy and stressed lately and have lost my patience. But at least they could ask "Hey! How are you feeling? Would you like to go out or chat?" - that's what frinds do. Not just fooling around or ask you to be there, stand by them when THEY have problems or feel depressed.

Shit! I must come round fast......Arggggggggggggggggggggggggg!!!!!!


PS. Pay no attention to this log. Just had to take it off me.

The past 3 weeks have been really awful for my psychology. Too many things and thoughts had been pilled up in my mind and since I am not of those who can easily express themselves I kept them inside me till I "emotionally exploded".All these weeks I have been feeling frustrated and melancholic about my life so far and what may come and I reacted really badly.Actually I orally attacked and screwed up with a friend. I took a week off work so as to come round ( if that's the correct phrasal.) I hope she forgives me.

 ".....But I won't cry for yesterday
 There's an ordinary world
Somehow I have to find
And as I try to make my way
To the ordinary world I will learn to survive

 What is happening to me?
Crazy, some'd say
Where is my friend when I need you most? Gone away......."

Ordinary World- Duran Duran"

 "...When the day is long and the night, the night is yours alone,
When you're sure you've had enough of this life, well hang on.
Don't let yourself go, everybody cries and everybody hurts sometimes.

Sometimes everything is wrong. Now it's time to sing along.
When your day is night alone, (hold on, hold on)
 If you feel like letting go, (hold on)
When you think you've had too much of this life, well hang on.

Everybody hurts.Take comfort in your friends.
Everybody hurts.Don't throw your hand. Oh, no. Don't throw your hand.
If you feel like you're alone, no, no, no, you are not alone

 If you're on your own in this life, the days and nights are long,
When you think you've had too much of this life to hang on."

 "Everybody Hurts" REM

It's been a long time my last entry but nothing relly special has happened  so as to mention it on LJ.( Nope, still heven't won the lottery and I haven't been nominated for the Oscars yet).

Last month I got a kitten as a b-day present. I named him Puk-like the naughty elf from Shakespeare's "Middsummer night's dream". He is 3 months old and one of the most beautiful kittens I 've ever seen (not because it's mine).I will try to upload a photo of him sometime.

Watching him for the past month I 've wondered a few things about cats, such as 
"Why do cats have a tail?"
a) to keep flies away / b)to chew it when they are hungry
and   " Has a cat's tail its own life?" well-I think it has. that's why Puk can't reach it every time he tries to grab it.

That's all for the moment about cats.

.......will be back.... meow!!!

I HATE MOSQUITOS!!!!I HATE MOSQUITOS!!!!I HATE MOSQUITOS!!!!I HATE MOSQUITOS!!!!I HATE MOSQUITOS!!!!I HATE MOSQUITOS!!!!I HATE MOSQUITOS!!!!I HATE MOSQUITOS!!!!I HATE MOSQUITOS!!!!I HATE MOSQUITOS!!!!I HATE MOSQUITOS!!!!I HATE MOSQUITOS!!!!I HATE MOSQUITOS!!!!I HATE MOSQUITOS!!!!I HATE MOSQUITOS!!!!I HATE MOSQUITOS!!!!I HATE MOSQUITOS!!!!


As you have already guessed I HATE MOSQUITOS!!!!

The past 8 days have been the worst for this year. I got bitten... or should I say attacked by a mosquito swarm (don't know if that's the correct word but I am bored to look it up in the dict).
My legs are full of red spots the size of coin and they itch as hell. Tried everything....nothing seems to work.I smell of cintronela oil and I spend 15 mins every morning and night apllying gels on the bites. 
 I HATE MOSQUITOS!!!!I HATE MOSQUITOS!!!!I HATE MOSQUITOS!!!!

My friends told me I could make money by that. I could start a mosquito breeding farm or join a circus as the "Mosquito Freak"... Last night I counted 35 (yes! 35)bites on my left leg...multiply by 3 and you get an idea of my nightmare.

I HATE MOSQUITOS!!!!I HATE MOSQUITOS!!!!I HATE MOSQUITOS!!!!

Just heard on the radio that the new James Bond will be.... LEGOLAS !!!!!

THAT! I would like to see! It seems that the James Bond producers were really impressed by Legolas' fighting skills (who can forget the Oliphant  or the Helm's Deep sequences?. But will the English compromise with an elf playing their Top Secret agent? And a blonde one.

"My name is Leg. Leg Bond... And I like my lembas stirred not shaken".

The first time I read a Terry Pratchet's book was a few years ago. I think it was Lords and Ladies.  I loved the guy. Weird humour, funny characters ( my fav is DEATH). I haven't read Weird Sisters cause it's difficult to find his books in Greece but whenever I come across to one in a book shop I buy it.

Hope you guys had a very nice holiday season with lots of fun and food (but don't you dare to complain that you have put any weight on - as some of you will do)

Another year has gone.... a new one has come (once again).

2004 was,I could say, a good year for me....and here is my list of the Top-5 best and worst moments, I should never forget.

Top-5 Best Moments:

1) Finally moved in my own house.Got rid of my sis (he-he) and have my own garden. The neighbours are a little annoying but I must live with them since they are my sis and my bro-in-low.

2) The Olympic Games that took place in Athens and Volos, and my participation to them. (No, I didn't win any gold medals but I have 3 sets of uniforms which I can sell for about 300 euros each, in case I need cash- No f****ing way I will ever do that) .

3) My new job. In May I had the opportunity to get rid of my old bosses (still the police hasn't found their corpses) and finally work with people I like and with no bosses (they are in Athens).

4) Impossible is Possible. Who could have imagined that the National Football (aka soccer) Team would ever win the European Cup. I asure you, I didn't.  And neither the rest of the European Football (that's soccer) Fans.

5)................... (there must be a fith one but I can't remember it- I will update later)


Top-4 Worst moments:

1) The Asian Tsounami disaster. What a tragedy.... I felt really "ashamed" when I had to celebrate the New Years Eve when so many people are suffering.

2)The aftermath (I think that's what it's called) of the Big Olympic Party.....

3)The end of the LOTR Trilogy..... No more Hobbits and Elves on the Big screen, no more anticipating for the extended DVDs.

4)The Bush's re-election..... Just hope that this a** won't make things worst for the rest of his presidency.


Well that's some of the things I should remember for the rest of my life (or as long as I am not suffering from memory loss)

Happy New Year again ....

It's been soooo long since my last entry that most of you must have deleted me of your lists....

Many things have happened that kept me away from being on line regularly... the Olympic Games, my work, etc.... I will be off line up to the begining of December cause I am moving home (for the last time) in a couple of weeks.

I have a lot of entries to read in order to catch up with you.... 

A book club??!!!!! What an excellent idea...I have already joined...

See you guys soon....
As Bruel told me, I have to clear out that by Football I mean the Soccer or European football- You know , the one played with your fee

10 more days before the Olympic Games begin (less than 8 for its unofficial  beggining). Of course this is the most important event of the summer - at least for me and most Greeks.

Last Saturday the Olympic Flame passed from my hometown, Volos. I wouldn'd miss this event for anything, so there I was along with 20000 people cheering and crying ( I did at least). The ceremony was impressive since it took in Volos' sea- side and the fullmoon background.

As you probably don't know (apart from Brue) my hometown is hosting the footaball tournament- along with 4 other cities- and I am a Volunteer, which means I am part of this gigantic event. I can't wait for the Games to begin.... Yesterday I spent about 4 hours inside the Football Venue, which was FANTASTIC.

I took some pics of the Flame and the Football venue but I don't know how to upload them to my Journal.  Any help would be apprecciated.....

Last Saturday while I was on line my comp went black..... In the begining I thought that I was hacked but it turned out that the comp's memory decided to retire....The blody thing cost me a few euros and a lot of time to set the comp up, cause I had to re-format the disc.... thankfully, my files were safe....

It's been a month since I went to my new work and things are much better.....

This Saturday the seminars for the Volunteers for the Olympics are starting and I hope to get my outfit by next week.....
I am very glad because two of the teams that are going to play in Volos are the Italian MEN's (I hope MALIDINI will play for Italy--- Drools) team and the Japaneese Men (and Women) teams..... there will also be the Sweedish WOMEN one.....

I have started refreshing my italian and i have bought a Greek-Japannese dialogue book....

Last Wednesday the... bestest thing happened while I was going to get my car.
I was offered a job to another bookshop, which is  better than the one I am working at the moment. 

For the past few months I had been thinking of leaving the place I am working at present because I wasn't satisfied.... I told myself that if things would get better I would leave by the end of May.... Until last Wednesday...

It was sheer luck.... if I had parked my car elsewhere... 
It's what Paolo Chuelo ( hope I spelt his name right)has said in "The Alchemist".....

"When you really want somethign to happen, the whole universe conspires so that your wish comes true"....and that has happened to me many times so far...

I watched Hildago last night. To be Frank (Sinatra?) I could do without seeing it.... I mean where were the Elves and the Hobbits? not even a a dwarf? I also noticed 4 similarities with Aragorn's character.
1) Aragorn... sorry I mean Viggo's character.. once again was in a dilema (whether to accept his half-indian origins.)  
2) Once again he is saved by his horse.
3)His Hildago character was a scouter (Strider)
4) He looked as cute as in LOTR.

.... Not even an Orc?

John's father works as a car mechanic somewhere outside Volos. He is 8 years old and obsesed with toy cars.
Last Sunday he was playing with his friend George (age 9) with their toy cars in his father's shop when they decided that toy cars are boring. Outside there was a 18 metres long track. They got into the cabin, started the engine and drove away.
 They managed to drive the track for about a kilometre when they lost control of it and hit a tree (thankfully, no one was hurt but the tree). They went back and found a car, which was there, got into, started the engine and drove for about 5 kilometers in the highway...until the car broke down...

So that's the explanation why Greeks are the best drivers in the world...

I woke up early today and I washed the car, which looked like a four- wheel ashtray. and what happened?  It started to rain only a couple of hours I fished cleaning it!!! GRRRRR&$^&#^$&$

The fellowship is breaking apart (?)- Ed told me yesterday that he won't be online anymore (at least not for this period)because he is moving . Not many of the regs are online too, I think I will step out too...(not that I have been online as much as I used to).

I bought Michael Moor's Stupid White Men book. It looks interesting so far..i also bought Duran Duran's Special edition DVD (YAYYYY) All my fav videos are in it... but spent all my money on them and now I am broke (LOL). I could use any help now...

Spring is officially here and so are my alergies...red eyes and running noses..Yuk! 

I watched Peter Pan yesterday. There were only 20 people in the cinema but I really enjoyed it. I should read the book ,too. I also saw the poster of Hildago movie. I can't wait to see Viggo again! Hope it's worth it... as for Troy I have heard they have completely changed the story.. that will be "fun" to see. I think their excuse was that The Iliad was a fiction story so they can adapt it anyway they think it better.

My volunteer application for the olympics has been accepted. I will be in the football stadium, here in Volos, as a Ven Host(whatever that means).I guess I will show people their seats and I will be able to see the football matches for free... and get a chance to be part of the whole "party".

At the age of 3, Vanja had to live with the company of a pack of stray dogs because he had no other choice.

Vanja was abandoned by his mother, next to a rubbish bin, in a small town near Moscow, when she chose to go away with her boyfriend to St. Petersburg. His father was in prison.

For the others he was nothing but "garbage". but he was lucky to be adopted by a pack of stray dogs. His new family were treating him with love as if he was one of the puppies, feeding him and protecting him from danger.

When he was four, he got his first job. He collected epmty bottleswhich he traded for money at the supermarkets. With the money he earned he bought food and some "generous" people gave him clothes. He couldn't talk but he he was playing with his dog friends as if he was one of them. Until one day a local policeman found him and took him to an orphanage. He was five years old.

In his first weeks there, he was hostile to everyone.Considering he had grown up with dogs, he couldn't talk, didn;t know how to eat at the table, he had never slept in bed etc. He was attacking and growling at everyone.

With the help of a specialised psycologist, in the next four years his attitude changed and he was adopted by a foster family, at the age of seven. Vanja had to live in a small house with 7 more people, but no problems occured. He was still under psychological support.

He could live with other people but it was difficult for him to learn how to talk.In his first year in school Vanja was neurotic unfriendly even hostile to his simblings an classmates but by the end of the year he could speak, read and behave, so he decided to join one of the many nillitary schools in Russia.

Today, at the age of 11, hesis a kid like the others, dreaming to become a captain. But he still fills his pockets with leftovers after each meal witch he gives to his old "family"....

Ok .Here is something that you may find useful if you plan to visit Greece.

This is how a Greek guy will try to "throw" you - that is to flirt you...It can also be used by foreign men to flirt Greek girls...

" Hi baby...Just want to have you in opa-opa because you are a searched woman... Carpet I will be to step on me... I am dog bored with all other women. They are shoppings. You tell them to do something and they make it sald and the they do the duck.But I don't chew. I like you because you say the fig- figs and the tub-tub. But if you don't want me, I will not mind. From go and the others...".

Still trying to make sence of what you have just read? Does it "sound all greek to you"? I'll  let you solve the puzzle...

Here is part of an article I picked up from the Reuters.

China may have 30-40 million frustrated bachelors by 2020 as a cultural preference for sons prompts couples to abort girls, leading to more prostitution and trafficking of women...The one-child policy threatens to create a population of unmarried men bigger than the entire population of Malaysia....

China's birth gender ratio was relatively normal in 1982 with about 108 boys for every 100 girls.But in 2000 there were about 117 boys for 100 girls...Such serious gender disportion would trigger such crimes and social problems as mercenary marriage, abduction of women and prostitution...Official figures in March showed police had freed 42,2125 kidnapped women and children in the two years to 2003 and analysts say that could be just the tip of the iceburg... Many of those abducted were sold into marriage, sexual slavery or as sons to childless couples...

Not that you would care about elections but here is an account of how Greek parliament elections are held....

Thousands of Greeks caught ferries, buses, planes even donkeys (jk) back to birthplace islands and mountain villages to vote.The main choice is between 2 political dynasties that have dominated modern political life. Here is a short profile of the 2 main opponents...

Ladies and Gents... On the right, representing New Demo cracy (conservatives) is Mr C.Karamanlis, nephew of the establisher of the party. 
For the past 7 years he has been trying to persuade the people that he is the perfect PM- plump, clumsy, with a beautiful wife that every politician would like to have. He is the beloved kid of grannies and elder people... Just don't ask him to play football ( he has broken his leg in front of the cameras trying to score).

On the left, representing PASOK (socialists) is Mr George Papandreou (aka Giorgakis- Little George). He is grandson of a former PM and son of the establisher of the party and also former PM,Andreas Papandreou.
He was elected president of PASOK by more that 1 million party voters (not really impressing since he was the only candidate) only because of his high poll ratings and for being his father's son.

The winner will be the 1st PM born after WW2. According to latest exit polls, the conservatives appear to be heading for an easy win. But some fear a return of the 2000 elections when ND supporters were on the streets celebrating early exit polls showing that their party was the winner only to see the Socialists surge the victory and remain in power  (for more than 18  years). 

Isn't that wonderful?

Today is the Greek Parliament Elections... I haven't voted yet (why should I hurry?). Everyone is making predictions... More on greek elections in my next entry.


The only good thing about the elections is that my cousin, who came from England to vote, brought me the "art of the TTT" and "The art of the ROTK" book, which are FANTASTIC... if you haven'; bought them yet... go and buy them.

It was freezing today all day! Below 0 again... but no snow in here. there is so much all over Greece but not here!!!!

Had a f***ing day at work, almost killed my bosses... I really need to find a new job. The whole thing is getting tiring.I don't have enough time to do something creative. Must get back to more teaching soon. Damn....

It finally snowed in Volos! not as much as I would like but at least i saw a "white day". I could stand in the middle of the street and let myself get covered in snow. A walking snowman. Unfortunatelly most of the snow in the city has already melted. The temprature has dropped to -4 degrees  and it will drop more the next days..... Perhaps I should take my reindeer and sledge out.

Action was taken today about the poisoning of the stray dogs. I sent a couple of emails to a major greek newspaper  and I hope that my letter will be published. We also decided to put some posters up in order to inform the people around the area and try to send as many emails as we can to the authorities.

OK! today I am really pissed off. Last night a sub-human poisoned 15 stray dogs close to the place where I work. I am a cat lover and those dogs where causing a few problems around the area, such as attacking paaser-bys and semi stary cats, but poisoning them is absolutely inhuman.

Stray cats and mostly dogs is a serious issue here on planet Greece, caused by those irresponsible adults who buy dogs (usually breed dogs) just for showing off which they get rid of them when they ae bored of taking care of them. Even those so-called pet lovers don't really care for the "problems" their pets sometimes cause- not many of them are willing to clean their dog's s**t when they take them for a walk.

Greece may have been the cradle of civilisation but many Greeks are far from being called civilised.

Stupid fat ... Greeks (Gollum speaking).

Finally, I have found the time to update my journal. you must excuse me guys but I was never good at writing journals of any type. Actually, if you want to tortre me just ask me to write a 500 word essay...

Anyway. I was jealous of you guys who went to the moot. from what I have read, Chetna must have had a wonderful time and made London shopkeepers richer.(By the way Chet, I hope this was your longest entry ever. It took me quite a lot of time to read- and I am a fast reader).

Lin I think I would have felt the same. All this walking around  especially with that cold... * shivers.

In my opinion, the next moot should take place in a different country. Let's say in June... by the sea... in tents ... or something like this. Any suggestions?

Note: if you ever have the chance, don't miss the Ennio Marchetto's pantomime show. He is hillarious

That's all folks...
The accident took place on the night of the 30th of december

Well... another new year has just started but how happy will it be? ....... I just hope it will be better than the last one. Gosh! that sounds so pessimistic....

Ok ( puts the happy face on).... I should write something funnier... Let me see... 

Ok last night was a typical New year's eve... we spent the first 2 hours at home with the family and then went to a bar where we drank and got drunk *hiccups...still trying to recover.Thank god i am not working tomorrow.

My sis surprised me yesterday by buying me a ticket to see ROTK...again .She did well!!! I had a really bad day at work and wathcing ROTK once more was the best thing. I really enjoyed that movie. Ok i know most of you will still nagging about the changes and the parts that were left out... but hey people it still is a damn good adaption of the books... 

I really enjoined the battle scenes and the Dimholt sequence (of course it wasn't as described in the books but it had a better effect on Aragorn's character).And Selob oh.. she was perfect. Of course Frodo looked like beeing a kokoretsi (that's a traditional greek food wich Chetna wouldn't like to taste). As for Lego's fight with  the Mumakil was so funny...

Can't wait for the extended DVD...

Merry christmas.
 This is the 1st official entry.

Another Christmas day is almost over. Loads of food and cokies have been eaten today. a real Greek Tsimpousi... (that's food, food and more food and wine)

It has snowed on Pelion mountain but there is no sign of snow in Volos. It's quite cold, though.
It's alittle confusing at the moment but i think i will like this new "toy"
I think I am going to love this new toy... let me see... i will try to invite Brue to read my diary
